fine_dining.name: Clochard
signature_dishes: Cod with Lemon Sauce and Caviar
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant dining with mirrors, fine lighting, and art de la table in a historic building on Mitropoleos Street
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book well in advance, especially for weekend dinners; considered one of the city's top fine dining establishments
fine_dining.local_tips: Impressive wine list with over 600 labels from around the world; balances traditional Greek dishes with innovative presentations; combines French techniques with Greek ingredients.

fine_dining.name: Charoupi
signature_dishes: Gooey Egg Yolks with Staka Cream
fine_dining.atmosphere: Sophisticated yet relaxed dining with elegant presentation and attentive service
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reserve in advance; mention any dietary preferences; ask for recommendations on Cretan wine pairings
fine_dining.local_tips: Run by acclaimed chef Manolis Papoutsakis since 2016; features over 10 carefully selected Cretan cheeses; offers a complimentary dessert after your meal; an excellent introduction to authentic Cretan cuisine.

fine_dining.name: Olympos Naoussa
fine_dining.atmosphere: Historic culinary landmark on the waterfront, elegantly restored to blend iconic past with contemporary sophistication
fine_dining.booking_tips: Request a table with sea views; weekend bookings should be made well in advance
fine_dining.local_tips: A Thessaloniki institution originally established in the 1920s; once hosted celebrities, artists and intellectuals; recently renovated to preserve its heritage while embracing modern Greek gastronomy.

casual_dining.name: To Elliniko
casual_dining.atmosphere: Authentic, welcoming taverna featured in Rick Stein's travel documentary
casual_dining.booking_tips: Popular with both locals and tourists; lively atmosphere
casual_dining.local_tips: Offers quintessential Greek dining experience with generous portions and friendly service; perfect for first-time visitors wanting to sample a variety of traditional Greek dishes.

casual_dining.name: To Manitari
casual_dining.atmosphere: Urban-chic restaurant with a beautiful balcony and impressive design in Kalamaria
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book in advance, especially for the balcony seating in summer
casual_dining.local_tips: Award-winning restaurant (Greece Best Restaurant Award 2018-2019); uses high-quality products from small producers throughout Greece; menu changes seasonally; excellent for a special night out.

casual_dining.name: Nea Diagonios
signature_dishes: Grilled Beef Liver with Pear and Mustard Sauce
casual_dining.atmosphere: Sleek, sophisticated steakhouse with modern decor
casual_dining.booking_tips: Request information about the meat cuts of the day
casual_dining.local_tips: Premium meat-focused restaurant with high-quality cuts and sophisticated preparations; veal fillet with summer truffle carpaccio and porcini cream is a standout dish; good wine selection to pair with meat dishes.

casual_dining.name: Grada Nuevo
casual_dining.atmosphere: Upscale seafood restaurant near Aristotelous Square
casual_dining.booking_tips: Specify if you have any seafood preferences when booking
casual_dining.local_tips: Specializes in fresh seafood and fish; some meat options available; excellent for business lunches or special occasions; popular with locals for celebrating important events.

street_food.name: Gyros Stands (various locations)
street_food.location: Throughout the city, particularly around Aristotelous Square and Navarinou Square
street_food.local_tips: Look for places where locals queue; freshly sliced meat from the vertical rotisserie is key; authentic gyros includes fries inside the pita; typically served with tzatziki, tomatoes, onions, and sometimes mustard.

street_food.name: Bougatsa Shops
street_food.location: Various locations, with famous shops near Modiano Market
street_food.local_tips: Serraikon near Modiano Market is famous for the best bougatsa in Thessaloniki; traditionally eaten for breakfast with powdered sugar and cinnamon; watch the skilled bakers stretch the dough by hand; bougatsa is a Thessaloniki specialty with Byzantine origins.

street_food.name: Feyrouz
street_food.local_tips: Popular lunch spot offering excellent quality, flavorful Middle Eastern street food that reflects Thessaloniki's multicultural heritage; vegetarian options available; items sell out quickly, so go early.

street_food.name: Koulouri Stands
street_food.location: Street corners throughout the city, especially near transit hubs
street_food.local_tips: The quintessential Thessaloniki breakfast on-the-go; best fresh in the morning; sometimes available with fillings like cheese or chocolate spread; pairs perfectly with Greek coffee.

coffee_shops.name: The Garden Bar
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Cozy modern interior with natural elements and greenery
coffee_shops.local_tips: Popular for its relaxed atmosphere and quality ingredients; comfortable benches and chairs with pleasant background music; generous portions; one of the city's best brunch spots.

coffee_shops.name: Ergon Agora
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Vibrant marketplace where modernity meets tradition
coffee_shops.local_tips: More than just a café - a comprehensive food experience; you can buy groceries and dine in the same location; Sunday brunch is particularly popular; excellent quality but service can be slow when busy.

coffee_shops.name: Palio Hamam
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Unique café set in a restored Ottoman bathhouse with layers of history
coffee_shops.local_tips: Sitting on some of Thessaloniki's oldest ruins; warm and cozy in winter with a fireplace; rooftop bar in summer offers views of the Ottoman baths; perfect blend of history and modern café culture.

coffee_shops.name: To Pikap
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Unique vinyl shop and café with authentic music ambiance
coffee_shops.local_tips: Not just a café but also a vinyl record shop; music played from the café's own vinyl collection; owners were formerly DJs; located in Old Town (Ano Poli); a haven for music lovers.

bars.name: Skyline - OTE Tower
bars.atmosphere: Elegant revolving bar atop the OTE Tower with 360-degree views of the city
bars.local_tips: The bar rotates completely in about 45 minutes, offering stunning panoramic views; recently renovated; ideal for special occasions; serves breakfast and brunch earlier in the day.

bars.name: Local
bars.atmosphere: Sophisticated wine bar at the busy intersection of Paleon Patron Germanou and Pavlou Mela streets
bars.local_tips: Owned by Nikos Vangelopoulos; excellent selection of Greek wines; perfect spot for people-watching; knowledgeable staff can help with wine recommendations; popular with local wine enthusiasts.

bars.name: Paraty
bars.atmosphere: Stylish bar with imposing central bar, cozy corners, comfortable vintage and art deco furniture
bars.local_tips: Features a special upstairs 'Loft' area reminiscent of a New York loft with a different list of wines and cocktails; attention to detail in both decor and drink preparation; sophisticated ambiance with curated music.

bars.name: Elephantas Cafe Bar
bars.atmosphere: Small, welcoming space with friendly staff and eclectic music (funk, jazz, Latin, reggae)
bars.local_tips: Though small in size, offers a homey, welcoming atmosphere; excellent music selection creates a relaxing environment; open from morning until late at night; popular with students and locals.

food_tours.name: Thessaloniki Food Tour
highlights: Sampling local specialties like bougatsa, koulouri, and meze
Learning about Thessaloniki's multicultural culinary history
food_tours.booking_tips: Book in advance online; wear comfortable walking shoes; come hungry; don't plan a big meal before or after; these tours showcase why Thessaloniki is a UNESCO City of Gastronomy.

food_tours.name: Sweet Thessaloniki Tour
highlights: Tasting local sweets like trigona panoramatos, tsoureki, and bougatsa
Learning about the city's sweet traditions
food_tours.booking_tips: Perfect for those with a sweet tooth; combines cultural and culinary history with dessert tastings; provides insight into the city's famous pastry scene.

food_tours.name: Greek Drinks Experience
highlights: Sampling various Greek drinks at local tavernas
Learning about wine, ouzo, tsipouro, and Greek coffee traditions
Discovering the culture around drinking in Greece
food_tours.booking_tips: Insightful tour with a local expert; great introduction to Greek drinking culture; includes food pairings with drinks at various stops.

cooking_classes.name: Cooking Class for Foodies
what_you_learn: Learning about Greek ingredients and cooking techniques
Understanding the stories behind Greek dishes
includes: All ingredients, printed recipes, meal with wine or fresh lemonade, dessert
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Held in the heart of the city by experienced local chefs; suitable for all skill levels; hands-on class with step-by-step guidance; leaves you with skills to recreate authentic Greek dishes at home.

cooking_classes.name: Greek Home Cooking Experience
cooking_classes.cuisine_focus: Authentic Greek Home Cooking with Modern Twists
what_you_learn: Traditional Greek dishes with personal touches
Preparing mezedes (appetizers) like tzatziki, fried eggplant, feta in wine leaves
includes: Transportation from city center, all ingredients, full meal with hosts, recipes to take home
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Takes place in a local home outside Thessaloniki; warm, personal experience with hosts; learn Greek cooking from a family perspective; consistently rated as a trip highlight by visitors.

markets.name: Kapani Market (Agora Kapani)
markets.local_tips: Authentic, bustling marketplace with a wide array of shops; vibrant atmosphere with vendors calling out their wares; great for photography; cafes nearby to relax after shopping; best place to experience local daily life and food culture.

markets.name: Modiano Market
markets.local_tips: Cross-shaped historic market recently renovated to blend historical character with modern amenities; now features both traditional market stalls and new dining venues; showcases Thessaloniki's famous food scene; some restaurants offer cooking with ingredients purchased directly from the market.

markets.name: Bit Bazaar
markets.hours: Varies by establishment, most active evenings and weekends
markets.local_tips: Unique area combining small antique shops with casual eateries; popular with locals and students; authentic, non-touristy dining options; interesting place to browse for unique items while sampling local food; prices generally lower than more tourist-centric areas.

spring: Wild greens (Horta) with lemon and olive oil
Easter specialties: red-dyed eggs, tsoureki (sweet bread), magiritsa soup
summer: Fresh seafood from the Thermaic Gulf
Cold soups like tarator (cucumber yogurt soup)
autumn: Mushroom dishes (especially from nearby Mt. Olympus)
Fresh olives and olive oil from the new harvest
winter: Christmas sweets: melomakarona (honey cookies) and kourabiedes (almond cookies)
